column4: i'm looking to build a computer with the Radeon HD 6850, but i'm not sure how good ubuntu's support is. anyone have relevant info?
i'd rather go with AMD
then don't come complaining about crappy performance ;)
oh, if the performance is crappy due to ubuntu's support, i most certainly would complain
no, the performance is crappy due to AMD delivering crappy drivers
what's the difference between commercial and SOHO printers?
about 4 feet?
huh? care to explain?
the one in the vid is about 4 feet taller than a home printer
nothing prevents you from buying a HP Color LaserJet 8000 series for home use.. except your budget perhaps :P
what i'm getting at is what about home printers?
well, what about them?
did you see the vid or catch any of the conversation? talking about resetting the printer chips so they can be refilled (yay antifeatures)
vid shows a likely expensive solution that may be good in a commercial setting, but what about home or small business users?
pretty futile to do so, you're breathing toxic dust if you do.. better have that done by a company that specializes in that, or buy refill cartridges
what are you talking about? no toxic dust when i refilled mine...
the point is they're pulling shenanigans to force people to unnecessarily buy replacements when we could refill them ourselves. did you know printer ink is more expensive than oil or human blood?
that should be user choice though. chip prevents that
same here, but i'd rather do it free. i just don't know about dealing with the chips... yet
well, you still pay for the ink or toner
nope. got it free
then you're just lucky
true, but it's going to waste because printer companies are asshats
